Description: Typical range for industrial cleaning of natural stones like Bluestone using 1064 nm fiber lasers; starting at 100W balances efficiency and safety to avoid thermal damage to porous substrate. Max limited by Bluestone's low thermal conductivity (~1-2 W/m·K) to prevent cracking. Source: Manufacturer specs from IPG Photonics YLR series and academic review in 'Laser Cleaning of Stone Surfaces' (J. Cult. Herit., 2018).
Near-IR wavelength optimized for Bluestone mineral absorption
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning control
Optimal repetition rate for efficient cleaning coverage
Nanosecond pulse width for controlled ablation of contaminants
Optimal scanning speed for uniform cleaning
Recommended number of passes for complete cleaning
Optimal beam overlap for uniform coverage
